abstract: Nuristan Province, isolated area in Afghanistan, has seen little progress due to its rugged terrain and poor infrastructure; area has become encampment site for Taliban and other militant groups due to its remoteness and proximity to Pakistan.
lead_paragraph: The difficult terrain of Nuristan Province has brought the region little development over the past 14 years, despite hundreds of billions in foreign aid flowing into the rest of the country.

headline.main: Afghan Province Tucked in Mountains Lies Beyond Reach of Aid and Time
headline.print_headline: Rugged Afghan Region Lies Beyond Reach of Aid and Time

snippet: The difficult terrain of Nuristan Province has brought the region little development over the past 14 years, despite hundreds of billions in foreign aid flowing into the rest of the country.
